title: Credicard Launches Special Line of Credit to Purchase Equipment for Blind And Low-Vision People In Brazil
summary: Sao Paulo - Credicard and Laramara NGO, a Brazilian Association that provides assistance to the visually impaired, signed a partnership to facilitate the acquisition of accessibility equipment for people who are blind or have low vision, such as magnifiers, Braille machines, text-to-speech software, voice canes, thermometers and pressure gauges, among other products.
tag-1: Credicard Launches Special Line of Credit to Purchase Equipment for Blind And Low-Vision People In Brazil
tag-3: Sao Paulo – Credicard and Laramara NGO, a Brazilian Association that provides assistance to the visually impaired, signed a partnership to facilitate the acquisition of accessibility equipment for people who are blind or have low vision, such as magnifiers, Braille machines, text-to-speech software, voice canes, thermometers and pressure gauges, among other products.
tag-4: Through Credicard Finance, the company will offer Laramara members and their families a special credit line, with better rates and payment services than those available in the market. This partnership will enable partial selling to people outside São Paulo, who did not have access to a line of credit for acquisition of equipment for the entity. The financing will be available in May at Laramara headquarters in Rua Conselheiro Brotero, 338 - Barra Funda - São Paulo.
tag-5: William Tsutsumida, Risk Management Credicard, says the initiative seeks to offer an additional option for Laramara associates: "Today, the entity already sells products for the visually impaired. However, purchases can only be made in cash or with short-term payment options. With this new credit line, which has a social imprint, we will facilitate the acquisition of products with lower rates that the ones available in the market."
tag-6: To qualify for the credit line, people must be between 18 and 75 years of age, be employed for at least six months and have an income equal or greater than minimum wage. The amount of financing ranges from R$200 to R$10,000, with payment facilities of up to two years. Applicants must also submit income statements, residence and identity documents, in addition to a fixed phone number.
tag-7: Laramara  Laramara – Brazilian Association of assistance to the visually impaired is a non-profit organization, without political or religious links. It was founded in September 7, 1991, by Victor and Mara Siaulys - parents of a blind girl - and by a group of working professionals in the field, devoted to giving access to education for many children, which could later share the experiences with their families. Since the beginning, the focus of institutional work was not only the individual care of the child, as it was usually the case, but his education and inclusion in a job that includes the family, school and community.
tag-8: Believed to be the learning and development of visually impaired people dependent on the opportunities that are offered to them, of access to appropriate materials and methods and, especially, the experience of interaction with objects and people, in physical and social spaces.
tag-9: It provides specialized educational care, with complementary actions and specific activities essential to the learning and development of people with visual impairments and the disabilities associated with it.
tag-10: The Specialized Educational Care comprises a set of actions and services that include social evaluation, ophthalmic evaluation and guidance for using optical aid, functional evaluation of vision and development; specialized educational care and complementary and supplementary educational program for young people and adults.
tag-11: The work of Laramara, which now completes 20 years, operates effectively in the town and state of São Paulo, and aims to also collaborate for the inclusion of people with visual impairments throughout Brazil.
